question_html: Is parking available within 50 m of an accessible entrance?
name: Parking Available

question_html: Is the crosswalk leading to the entrance of the parking clearly marked?
name: Crosswalk Leading to the Entrance

question_html: Does the parking lot have lighting?
name: Parking Lot Lighting

question_html: Are the curb cuts or ramps even with the paved surface/road?
name: Cut Curbs or Ramps

question_html: Are the curb cuts/ramps brightly marked?
name: Cut Curbs or Ramps - Brightly Marked

question_html: Do curb cuts or ramps have tactile paving?
name: Cut Curbs or Ramps - Tactile Paving

question_html: Is the entrance well lit or does the entrance have good lighting?
name: Entrance Lighting

question_html: Is there a ramped or ground level access at main entrance?
name: Ramp or Ground Level Access

question_html: Is an alternative wheelchair entrance available?
name: Wheelchair Access

question_html: Is the automatic access button or automatic door working? (Answer Yes for doorless entrance)
name: Automatic Access

question_html: Is the doorway wide enough to allow wheelchair access (width over 38 inches or 96 cm)?
name: Wide Doorway

question_html: Is seating available? (Lobby, waiting area, park...)
name: Seating Features

question_html: Are chairs with armrests available?
name: Seating Features - Chairs Are With ArmRests

question_html: Are chairs or seating removable?
name: Seating Features - Chairs Are Removable

question_html: Is there enough space under the tables for wheelchair footrest or leg clearance?
name: Under Table Leg Clearance

question_html: Are there counters at the reception or service desk with lower height for wheelchair access? (There should be at least 1 available)
name: Counter (Reception or Service Desk) Has Wheelchair Access

question_html: Do wheelchair accessible counters at the reception service desk have under counter clearance?
name: Counter (Reception or Service Desk) Has Under Counter Clearance

question_html: Are there wide aisles or pathways to allow wheelchair or walker access and navigation?
name: Aisles/Pathways with Wheelchair Access

question_html: Is the area free of tripping hazards or thresholds?
name: Area Free of Tripping Hazards

question_html: Is there an elevator?
name: Elevator Available

question_html: Are there auditory cues in the elevator?
name: Auditory/Audible Cues

question_html: Is there braille or tactile signage outside of elevator?
name: Braile/Tactile Information - Elevator

question_html: Are there audible indicators that the elevator is arriving?
name: Auditory/Audible Cues

question_html: Are all buttons accessible from a seated position?
name: Wheelchair Accessibility - Buttons

question_html: Is there enough room in the elevator for a wheelchair to turn?
name: Wheelchair Accessibility - Elevator

question_html: Does the elevator have automatic verbal announcements indicating the floor?
name: Auditory/Audible Cues - Floor

question_html: Does the elevator have automatic verbal announcements indicating when going up or down?
name: Auditory/Audible Cues - Up and Dpwn

question_html: Is there braille or tactile signage for button selection?
name: Braile/Tactile Information - Button Selection

question_html: Are large print or symbol-based signs available inside the elevator?
name: Large print or Symbol-Based Signs

question_html: Is a bathroom available?
name: Bathroom Availability

question_html: Are family or unisex bathrooms available?
name: Family/Unisex Bathroom Availability

question_html: Is the doorway wide enough to allow wheelchair access(width over 38 inches or 96 cm)?
name: Wheelchair Access - Wide Doorway

question_html: Is the access button or automatic door working? (Answer Yes for doorless entrance)
name: Automatic Door

question_html: Is the stall large enough to turn a wheelchair or walker?
name: Wheelchair Access - Stall

question_html: Are grab bars mounted beside the toilet?
name: Grab Bars

question_html: Is there leg clearance under the sink for wheelchair access?
name: Wheelchair Access - Under The Sink

question_html: Is the counter or sink low enough for wheelchair access?
name: Wheelchair Access - Counter

question_html: Do taps have lever handles or working motion sensors?
name: Grab Bars - Motion Sensors

question_html: Is there a working sensor or one hand activated soap dispenser?
name: Motion Sensors - Soap Dispenser

question_html: Is there a working sensor hand dryer (paper or hot air)?
name: Motion Sensors - Hand Dryer

question_html: Is there a large weight capacity change table in a private area?
name: Change Table

question_html: Is a ceiling track lift available?
name: Ceiling Track Lift

question_html: Has a roll-in shower (wheelchair accessible or built-in bench)
name: Roll-In Shower

question_html: Are grab bars available in shower or tub area?
name: Grab Bars Availability In Shower

question_html: Are there picture-based symbols for information and signage?
name: Large Print or Picture-Based Symbols

question_html: Is there braille or tactile signage at emergency exits?
name: Braile/Tactile Signage

question_html: Is braille or tactile information available?
name: Braile/Tactile Information

question_html: Is large print written information available?
name: Large Print Written Information

question_html: Are quiet sections available?
name: Quiet Sections

question_html: Is free Wi-Fi available?
name: WiFi

question_html: Is Closed Captioning (CC) available on display screens? Answer N/A to Location if there are no screens.
name: Closed Captoining (CC)

question_html: Are assisted listening devices available?
explanation:
Examples of assistive listening devices are:
  • amplified telephones which have volume control for both the ringer and the handset, and
  • wireless headsets which allow for individual sound amplification in theatres, auditoriums or museums.

The availability and use of a microphone and speaker system for all public announcements/presentations can also be considered an assistive listening accommodation.
name: Assisted Listening Devices

question_html: Is signage displayed in high contrast?
name: High Contrast

question_html: Is/Was staff assistance available upon request?
name: Staff Assistance

question_html: Is ceiling track lift available in the medical or doctor office?
explanation: Ceiling track/mechanical lifts are used to lift individuals into and out of their wheelchairs. A sling, positioned under the client is required to be used in conjunction with the ceiling lift/mechanical lift. Electric lift units need to be charged and in good working order in order to be effective.
name: Ceiling Track Lift - Doctor Office

question_html: Are large print or symbol-based signs available outside the elevator?
name: Large Print or Picture-Based Symbols - Outside The Elevator

question_html: Is the toilet seat high enough for wheelchair access?
name: Wheelchair Access - Toilet Seat

question_html: Are there visual indicators(lights) that the elevator is arriving?
name: Visual Indicators
